normalised: Automotive News: A Wave of Vehicle Launches Signals Industry Shift

unnormalised: This week saw a flurry of vehicle launches across various segments, signaling a dynamic shift in the Indian automotive landscape. Dr. Meena Iyer, Head of Automotive Research at IIT Madras, highlights the growing consumer demand for feature-rich and fuel-efficient vehicles, driving manufacturers to innovate.

Doctor Meena Iyer, Head of Automotive Research at I I T Madras, highlights the growing consumer demand for feature-rich and fuel-efficient vehicles, driving manufacturers to innovate.

unnormalised: Tata Motors unveiled its new electric SUV, the 'Nexon EV Max Pro', promising a range of 450 km on a single charge, targeting the eco-conscious urban buyer. Maruti Suzuki launched a CNG variant of its popular 'Baleno' hatchback, aiming to cater to budget-conscious buyers seeking lower running costs.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Mahindra showcased its 'Scorpio-N Adventure Edition' focused on off-road capabilities. The features include a reinforced chassis and higher ground clearance. The automotive industry is also seeing a rise in advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS), enhancing safety and convenience. Experts predict that these launches will positively impact the automotive ancillary sector, creating new jobs and opportunities in manufacturing and R&D. These factors collectively showcase the sector's resilience and adaptability in the face of evolving consumer preferences and technological advancements. Rs. 10,000 Cr investment in vehicle testing facilities is also planned within a 50,000 sq ft area near Chennai.
